answers.answer: I think they are pretty much the same.  However I know they have a tendency to make you constipated so be aware of that and increase your water intake or ask ahead of time what you can do to try to prevent the constipation.

Hi!! The exact same thing happened to me yesterday!! I was borderline gestational diabetes with my first child so I was thrilled at the news that those numbers were ok. The iron level helps explain why I haven't been able to pick my head up off the pillow so that was really some good news too!! My doctor wanted me to get slow fe iron pills, there is just one mg dosage and you only take one per day so that is the kind they told me to get. Good Luck!! Ginger

Thanks for your advice.  Ginger, I also bought the slow-fe tabs and hope that does the trick.  I did a bit of research on low iron yesterday and it was as if I wrote all of the symptoms myself.  I've been wondering if it was normal to be SO tired, dark circles under my eyes, leg cramps at night, and an excellerated heartrate.  SOmetimes when I lay down it feels like my heart is racing a million miles a minute. Hopefully these tabs will do the trick for both of us.  Good luck and happy new year.Shannon

question: Hi,I had my glucose test yesterday and the lab work on that all came back fine.  Doc did say however that my iron was a bit low and recommended an additional supplement. Any recommendations on brands or are they all basically the same? I am taking prenatals too and have been throughout the pregnancy.  Thanks and Happy New Year.
title: low iron
